title: Behind The Set Of Squid Game
description:
Squid Game impresses in so many ways - and their sets throughout the show are no different! Shockingly, very little CGI was used in cases it would be pretty typical in - outdoor scenes, larger than life objects‚Ä¶ but the team behind the Netflix hit went all out and built loads of the sets from the ground up.
The scale and variety is impressive, but what makes us love the work even more is the little hidden messages throughout the show. There are murals on a wall, stacked metal beds alluding to themes in the show - truly every aspect was considered. 
The realistic sets were a bit help in getting the actors into character and one cast member in particular had a major nostalgia moment when he walked onto the sets of the marbles game. These impactful sets could actually transport performers! Some actors felt like they were in a fantasy land, from the colourful and nonsensical staircases to giant children‚Äôs playgrounds to tug-of-war platforms. The staircase itself is actually inspired by a famous piece of art!
While the dorms may have been somewhat dull looking, the size of the set was enormous and some actors felt like they were performing in a colosseum! The prison-like aesthetic is a strong contrast to all the environments we see during the games. The sets weren‚Äôt the only huge parts of the show - Red Light, Green Light featured a huge and terrifying prop that managed to steal the show. 
So many worlds were created in just one small space, a filming studio about an hour outside of Seoul, South Korea - a studio where the magic of Squid Game came to life!

title: Avatar Scenes Without CGI
description:
Ever since it debuted in theaters in December of 2009, James Cameron‚Äôs science fiction epic Avatar, has become a cultural phenomenon, it kickstarted the trend of 3D movies and is still the highest grossing movie of all time at the worldwide box office (though it was briefly unseated by Avengers: Endgame). The film is set in the future and follows Jake Sully, an injured former Marine who is recruited for a mission on the alien planet of Pandora. He soon is transported into the body of one of the Na‚ÄôVi and forms a close relationship with one of the Na‚ÄôVi whose name is Neytiri. From romance, action, suspense, and science fiction, Avatar has it all. Even eleven years after the film‚Äôs original release the CGI still holds up magnificently and there was clearly a lot of work that went into making the film. From all the motion-capture technology for the human actors to portray the Na‚ÄôVi (and even mo-cap for the film‚Äôs animal actors), as well as building the film‚Äôs extensive sets digitally and physically, there was clearly a lot that went into making Avatar look as beautiful as it does. From Na‚ÄôVi tribal dances, to kisses, creating both beast and machine, and performing out of this world stunts, Cameron and his team clearly went the extra mile when bringing Avatar to life. There is really no question why the film has become so big in the pop culture landscape and with the several sequels on the horizon, it‚Äôs footprint is about to get even larger.

title: Squid Game With And Without Special Effects
description:
What Squid Game Scenes Look Like Without CGI 

Was the filming experience of Squid Game as intense as the games themselves? In many cases - yes! The production team behind the Netflix K-Drama sensation went all out, recreating intense conditions and shockingly realistic settings. Filming the Glass Stones scene took a lot of meticulous planning to make sure all the footage needed was captured - no small feat since instead of resorting to CGI for the major glass explosion, they made it happen for real in the studio! Filming took place in multiple stages - not dissimilar to Tug of War! The actors had to perform at one hundred percent to make sure the scene came off authentically, all while tugging for their lives, hanging just over the edge or group swinging off a platform. Red Light, Green Light had a huge set- one that had even more people on set behind the scenes to make sure every component was in place. Aside from the background, very little CGI was used in the scene- even all the perished bodies strewn around the playing area were the real actors, lying still until they finished filming. The last round taking place in the same space, the brutal Squid Game between Gi-Hun and Sang-Woo brought absolute chaos to the screen. On the set, it got pretty chaotic, especially since they really made it rain and the actors and camera crew were all working under much harsher conditions. 
From incredible and colorful set designs to daring practical stunts, the Squid Game team didn‚Äôt hold anything back.

title: Actors Painful Prosthetics And Makeup In Disney Live Actions
description:
Behind The Scenes Of Disney Movies Prosthetics, Costumes and Make Up! Subscribe: http://bit.ly/Subscribe-to-Things

Disney live-action movies feature some of the most incredible costumes, hairstyling, makeup and prosthetics that bring our favorite fairy tales to life. But wearing these iconic costumes wasn‚Äôt always easy for the dedicated actors. Angelina Jolie spent hours having her face poked and prodded to apply and remove her prosthetics as Maleficent. Lily James has to wear a corset so tight to fit into her Cinderella ball gown that people thought her waist had actually been digitally shrunk. And you won‚Äôt believe how painful those glass slippers really were. 

Emma Watson loved Belle‚Äôs yellow ball gown in Beauty and the Beast, but it was deceptively thick. Meanwhile, Dan Stevens got an even worse end of the deal and had to wear a heavy muscle suit with stilts to become the beast. Emma Stone also got to experience some incredibly heavy fashions as Cruella-- she had super long trains on some of her dresses that she could barely even walk in. The award for most insane makeup might go to Alice in Wonderland, though-- Helena Bonham Carter had an entire fake forehead as the Red Queen and Johnny Depp wore crazy contacts as the Mad Hatter. 

From Will Smith‚Äôs skin-tight motion capture suit and Naomi Scott‚Äôs tightest Prince Jasmine dress to Mulan‚Äôs heavy fighting outfits, costume designers like Colleen Atwood and Sandy Powell have worked real movie magic. But which Disney live-action flick do you think had the most painful costume or most uncomfortable makeup? Click play and let‚Äôs find out.

title: 10 Actors Who Auditioned For Stranger Things But Were Rejected
description:
Stranger Things has quickly become one of Netflix‚Äôs and TV's biggest hits. With its 80s nostalgia and ability to capture an audience of any age, there‚Äôs nothing the scifi show can‚Äôt do. But - getting to the point of success didn‚Äôt come without its low points - including a lot of rejection for the actors and the Duffer Brothers themselves. 

Casting for a show like Stranger Things involved months of research, preparations, and auditions that in this case left over one thousand actors with no call backs, no offers,  or just flat out rejections. 
 
Ready to find out why actors like Noah Schnapp and Joe Keery didn‚Äôt almost make the cut or how Sean Astin's audition tape completely changed the casting crews tactics. Auditions for Stranger Things were just as - if not more- intense than taking a trip to the upside down to save Will. 

Did you know we were this close to not having David Harbour and Winona Ryder as our Hopper and Joyce, these two actors weren‚Äôt anywhere on the Duffer Brothers radar. The expectations for a Stranger Things audition tape were through the roof, just ask Dacre Montgomery! Some actors even lied their way to the top which almost cost them their reputation and the Stranger Things roll. 

Luckily things worked out in the end, but it was a rollercoaster getting there for many involved. What audition story was your favorite? Do you know of any other actors who auditioned for Stranger Things? Let us know in the comment section below. Thanks for watching!

title: 15 Difficult Scenes To Film In Stranger Things
description:
Stranger Things has some of the most intense scenes put to screen! And that is in large part thanks to the incredible actors that bring the show to life. Millie Bobby Brown, Finn Wolfhard, Dacre Montgomery and Sadie Sink are just a few of the amazing actors that give their all into creating their characters. This level of intensity means sometimes things get dangerous on set, both physically and mentally. There are numerous examples of our favorite actors losing their voices due to screaming too much. One actor stated they lost their voice nearly every day while shooting! There were also plenty of injuries to go around. From scrapes and bruises, contacts that burned eyes, temperatures that ranged from freezing cold to scorching hot, and nauseating stunts that made actors throw up, filming these scenes was no joke. 

There was also the mental side of filming. Many of these actors were part of emotionally exhausting and mentally draining scenes. This would lead to actors crying before, during, and after shooting. Some scenes got really intense, to the point where the actors had to comfort each other when the cameras weren‚Äôt rolling. Balancing raw emotions with intense physicality was tricky at times. In one particular incident, it led to an actor putting his head through a glass window. 

We are really impressed with the commitment each of these actors have towards their roles. They gave it their all every day, and the results speak for themselves. Which scene do you think was the most intense? Let us know in the comments, and thanks for stopping by at The Things!

title: Marvel Actors Physical Transformations For A Role
description:
When you see superheroes such as Iron Man, Captain America, and Thor kicking butt on the big screen, there‚Äôs a ton of work that went in behind the scenes by the actors to achieve their hero body. Some MCU actors like Chris Pratt and Paul Rudd were far from ripped and muscular when they were cast in their respective roles. However, they put in the work to attain the fit and athletic bodies they sport on screen. This is no easy feat, as getting your body into peak shape is an incredibly difficult task. Sometimes it take‚Äôs over a year of strict dieting and workout plans to achieve their goals. And then years more maintaining this shape for future movies in the MCU. Luckily for them, they are provided with top of the line trainers and dieticians that help them along their journey. This definitely helps, but it‚Äôs still on the actors to apply themselves to the regimes assigned. Which actors had difficulties maintaining their diets?
Sometimes the trainers used by these actors are actually good friends with them, as is the case with Chris Hemsworth, who has known his trainer since he was four years old.

All those muscles aren‚Äôt just for show, and these actors have done some seriously impressive things. One of the Marvel stars can now push a 5,000 pound jeep. Do you think it‚Äôs Captain America or Captain Marvel who showcased this feat of strength?

Which actor do you think had the most impressive transformation?

title: Harry Potter Actors' LEAST Favorite Scenes To Film
description:
While living at Hogwarts and soaring through the air on flying broomsticks might seem like the most exciting and memorable experiences, the truth is the actors on the Harry Potter film sets didn‚Äôt always have such a great experience bringing magic to the screen. 

Ron actor had to face his real life fear - spiders! Like his character, Grant suffers arachnophobia. The underwater scenes look cool on screen - both figuratively AND literally. When filming during some of the coldest months of the year, the actors often found themselves freezing in water, feeling absolutely miserable. Rupert Grint felt so unwell once, he thought his heart had stopped beating and Daniel Radcliffe dealt with two ear infections! Let‚Äôs be honest, we‚Äôve all wanted to mount a flying broom and try our hand at Quidditch, but hearing from  those who‚Äôve actually experienced the wizarding world sport changes how keen we are to try. The actors hated having to film those scenes as they all found themselves in lots of pain and winding up with ‚Äúnumb bums.‚Äù 
In the later films as the characters are growing up, the content gets a bit more mature and kissing becomes more common. The actors, who‚Äôd all known each other for years and had very family-like relationships with each other dreaded filming these kissing scenes. Instead of being romantic, they were usually just very awkward. Having a whole crowd of people watching and filming very up close probably didn‚Äôt help matters either. The Room of Requirement may be a brilliant saviour for the witches and wizards throughout the series, but filming in the room wasn‚Äôt the best for the actors. Some actors were left feeling hysterical from claustrophobia and others were overheating - yikes!

title: 20 Marvel Actors Who Stole Props From Set
description:
Marvel blockbusters are typically filled with plenty of unique and lavish props and costumes, which can sometimes catch the eyes of the actors and filmmakers behind the films. Sometimes they‚Äôll become so drawn to these props and costumes, that after filming they‚Äôll take the props home with them, even when they‚Äôre not really supposed to. These items can range from props that play substantial roles in the film like Thor‚Äôs hammer Mjolnir, Doctor Strange‚Äôs Eye Of Agamotto, or even the legendary infinity stones themselves. Other times it can be something different that catches the superhero starlets‚Äô eyes such as Tom Holland snagging a blue screen from the set of Far From Home to repurpose it as a topper for his poker table. The actors can even get so carried away that they‚Äôll just take their hero costumes home with them, which is exactly what Ryan Reynolds and Andrew Garfield did with their Deadpool and Spider-Man costumes. But who can blame them? Then there‚Äôs actors like Tom Hiddleston and Sebastian Stan whose  mementos from the set are a scarf and KY-Jelly. Robert Downey Jr did the most Tony-Stark thing ever by taking the Avengers‚Äô A logo from the set of Age of Ultron and proudly displayed it in his office. If we were on the set of a Marvel film, we‚Äôd probably want to take some souvenirs home too. So grab your hammer and shield as we dive into the Marvel stars who stole props from the set.

title: The Voices Behind Disney's Encanto
description:
We‚Äôre heading to Colombia to hang out with one of the coolest families around - none other than the magical Madrigals! This incredible cast is stacked with some of the best performers around - but the secret behind this cast is‚Ä¶ many of them never actually acted before! From the seasoned veterans to the newbies who brought their talents to the Disney screen - no one missed a beat when filming Encanto.
Stephanie Beatriz is no stranger to the business - the Argentinian-born actress has spent loads of time doing voiceover in the booth and acting in Brooklyn 99 as Rosa Diaz. Being part of this film was extra special for the actress - especially since her father is Colombian! 
There was no shortage of legends in this cast. We‚Äôre talking about the likes of John Leguizamo, Mar√≠a Cecilia Botero, Diane Guerrero, and Wilmer Valderrama just to name a few!
There were some other pros in this movie who didn‚Äôt happen to be so well-versed in the filming world - but that didn‚Äôt stop them from blowing us out of the water. You‚Äôd never guess that Adassa and Mauro Castillo had never done any acting before because their parts in the movie made their mark. We wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if we start hearing their voices a whole lot more!
What was extra special about this whole cast is that all of them had some personal connection to Colombia - either they were from there themselves - Mar√≠a Cecilia Botero recorded the entire movie from her home country- or one of their parents was Colombian. Getting to celebrate that culture and passion boosted everyone‚Äôs performance and left us with work that is nothing short of amazing. We‚Äôre Encanto fans, there‚Äôs no doubt about it.

title: 12 Extreme Rules The Squid Game Cast Had To Follow
description:
The Squid Game cast may be incredibly famous, but they definitely earned it - not only with their incredible performances, but with the amount of rules they had to follow and work they had to do to be part of this special show. 
Working on the most successful show ever on Netflix was definitely exciting and we‚Äôd think the actors would want to talk about all the cool stuff they got to do - but that was a major no no, the actors couldn‚Äôt even do any interviews with press unless it was okay with the production. The actors also had to commit to staying in shape - if they didn‚Äôt, they could risk not being able to carry out the highly physical scenes and since the actors didn‚Äôt have stunt doubles, this was a serious issue. One actor had to stay in shape AND gain nearly forty pounds! While it helped the show, the actor still suffered quite a bit physically because of the intense demands. Working on a project this ambitious takes a lot of time and concentration - but that didn‚Äôt stop one actor from taking on a major role while still writing his university thesis! That actor was allowed to do both, but he had to rise to the occasion and commit all his energy to the show when he was needed. 
One actor couldn‚Äôt speak with their normal accent - they had to spend time training with an accent coach in order to sound how they needed to for the show. It may not have been easy, but committing to all these rules was a major contributor to making the show as amazing as it is!

title: The Voices Behind Disney's Turning Red
description:
Turning Red features the best voice talent around, from seasoned actors to popular singers, to performers totally new to the business! Who brought the heart and soul to these character voices? We‚Äôve got the scoop on who the actors are and where they came from - along with some clips of them in action, doing what they do best in the booth.
Rosalie Chiang may be young - but she was even younger when she got this job and started the process. The actress is as inexperienced as they come, ‚ÄòTurning Red‚Äô being the first feature film she‚Äôs ever performed in. Not a bad first gig! She got the delight of working with a seasoned and beloved veteran- the one and only Sandra Oh. One spunky actor made sure their presence was known - something anyone who‚Äôs watched ‚ÄòNever Have I Ever‚Äô would be familiar with. Maitreyi Ramakrishnan brings her energy to one of Mei‚Äôs best friends. Ava Morris is a real-life teenager- no wonder she‚Äôs a pro at playing a teen on screen. Hyein Park is new to acting - this being her very first role - but the performer has had a longstanding relationship with Pixar in a completely different department! 
Anne-Marie, the UK singer-songwriter wasn‚Äôt feeling as comfortable as she usually does in the booth - but she made it through and managed to bring some solid work to the table. Ever heard of actress and comedian Sherry Cola? If not -after hearing her performance in this, you won‚Äôt forget her!
Then, of course, are the five boys behind the voices of everyone‚Äôs new favorite boy band- 4*town. We‚Äôve got all the details you need on this talented crew.

title: Twilight Behind The Scenes And Cute Moments
description:
Hey-TheThings fans! Welcome back to another video. The Twilight Saga took the world by storm when it premiered in 2008 and changed what we all thought we knew about vampires. With the added angsty love triangle between Bella Swan, Edward Cullen, and Jacob Black, fans across the globe became obsessed with the franchise. The Twi-hards were born! 

However, none of this would have been possible without the effort that went into the first film from the cast and crew, especially director Catherine Hardwicke. So what made the first film - Twilight - so special? 

Summit Entertainment and the cast in the film were new off the scene, which means besides Stephenie Meyers fanbase the film didn‚Äôt have much recognition while in production. Therefore their budget was extremely tight - but maybe that only brought the cast and crew closer together! 

In this video, we‚Äôre showing you some of the best behind the scenes and cute moments between the cast that‚Äôll have Twilight fans reeling at how their favorite film was brought to life. From the visual effects and practical effects to Rob and Kristen‚Äôs very awkward chemistry test, Twilight was unique both on and off the screen.

Between the special effects coordinator who was able to make the movie possible despite its low budget and a dedicated cast and crew, they were able to pull it off. 

In the end, the Twilight film put both the cast and Summit Entertainment on the map. The rest is history! What behind-the-scenes moment is your favorite? Let us know in the comment section below. Thanks for watching!

title: Harry Potter And The Order Of Phoenix Behind The Scenes
description:
On Set Secrets From Harry Potter And The Order Of The Phoenix 

The Harry Potter Franchise could definitely be considered one of the greatest fantasy series there is. Today we‚Äôre taking a look behind the scenes at the 5th Harry Potter movie, The Order of the Phoenix. This film is a special one, especially considering its when Albus Dumbledore passes away. This is also one of the Daniel Radcliffe movies that sees Harry facing VERY intense obstacles. So how did the actors spend their time on set? Tonks was spending her time playing original tunes on her guitar, while Matthew Lewis and Alfred Enoch spent their time playing cricket instead of doing homework. While they were on set, the actors were taught some very intricate wand choreography so they could properly portray the elite wand battling on screen! As for Fred and George Weasley, the actors who portrayed them, alongside Bonnie Wright, seemed to have a bit TOO much time on their hands when they were pulling pranks all over the set - especially one that actually involved a huge construction site across the road from their film studio! 
There was one very big break taken during the shooting of the film - nine weeks in order for Daniel Radcliffe and Emma Watson to complete some major school exams!  Speaking of Hermione and Harry - remember the scene where they were giggling incessantly with Ron discussing Harry‚Äôs kiss with Cho? That was pure laughter from the actors who by that point knew each other extremely well and were dear friends - the team kept the camera‚Äôs rolling and happened to include this improv in the final edit!
We‚Äôre covering all this and more including differences between the books and movies as well as some key directorial choices that made this movie the incredible film it was!

title: 15 Painful Stranger Things Scenes To Film
description:
Stranger Things is an intense TV show so it‚Äôs no surprise to hear that its young cast struggled to film it. It was downright painful at times. From emotional pain, like missing your friends to vomiting and stingy-burning pain, the struggles this cast endured were very specific to this show. Millie Bobby Brown, who plays Eleven, is not one to go easy on herself, and this led her down a few dark paths. One had her collapse out of sheer exhaustion and another made her vomit. Only one of these moments made it into the show, we bet you can guess! She was also contending with a broken knee which couldn‚Äôt have been a whole lot of fun. She watched from the sidelines as her stunt double frolicked in The Upside Down. Dacre Montgomery who plays Billy Hargrove is almost as intense as Millie. He shattered a window in one improvised moment but wasn‚Äôt as lucky as his co-star. His moment to shatter the glass ceiling just wasn‚Äôt right. Dacre had a deep dark secret hidden right beneath his millions of prosthetics. Both Noah Schnapp and Joe Keery‚Äôs eyes were burning thanks to some costume department choices. Running around as a Demogorgon sounds like fun‚Ä¶ in theory. But in reality, it was very difficult to navigate the creature suit. And so the Demogorgon was replaced. Yes, Stranger Things sure has dealt with its fair share of overwhelming incidents. There are just too many to list. So why not give the video a watch?

We all love Harry Potter. J.K. Rowling‚Äôs Wizarding world has cast a spell on us that we haven‚Äôt been able to break, not that we‚Äôd want to. This near perfect film series is beloved by fans all around the world. And seems just as relevant now as all the way back in 2001. With eight movies in the series, though, there‚Äôs bound to be things that the creators missed.  While some muggles may have missed these magical mistakes, our eagle eyed wizards were able to catch 20 of the mistakes that slipped right past the editors. With the series spanning over 10 years, the technology and visual effects behind the magic was bound to improve, but that doesn‚Äôt mean there weren‚Äôt some bumps along the way. 

From all of the fake birds and creatures spotted on camera, to the not so magical green-screens. Complete character changes from one shot to the next, disappearing injuries, wires and electronics left in backgrounds, and Rupert Grint‚Äôs many blunders on set. Not to mention, you wouldn‚Äôt believe what's been powering Hogwarts technology this whole time .. batteries?! We will be taking a look at mistakes that will be impossible to ignore once you see them. So let's take a trip back in time across all 8 of the Harry Potter films for the mistakes only Muggles could have missed! And no, not even Alastor Moody's magic eye could catch these. title: Harry Potter Auditions And How The Cast Landed The Role
description:
Behind The Scenes Of Harry Potter Cast Auditions As Child Stars 
Subscribe: http://bit.ly/Subscribe-to-Things

Hey Potterheads! Today on TheThings we‚Äôre taking a trip back to the year 2000 when the casting for Harry Potter and the Philosopher‚Äôs Stone first kicked off. It‚Äôs hard to believe it‚Äôs been more than two decades since the start of the franchise but even more difficult to believe that the Harry Potter cast we know and love was almost completely different. We‚Äôre not kidding! 

The Harry Potter actors have very unconventional casting stories, but we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. From chance meetings at the theatre to casting directors scouring London primary schools - it‚Äôs so interesting to hear these actor‚Äôs individuals stories. 

And a little startling to find out that some of the cast members weren‚Äôt the first choice for their roles. 

We‚Äôre pretty sure you‚Äôll have a hard time believing how these actors got their roles - it‚Äôs wild. Did you know that the Phelps twins had no idea who they were cast as until the first day on set? Or that Tom Felton originally auditioned for two other roles before landing Draco Malfoy? 

We‚Äôll be covering almost the entire cast from Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint, and Emma Watson all the way to Alan Rickman, Tom Felton, and Helena Bonham Carter. 

The paths to getting the cast we see on our screens today may have been unconventional but we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. What audition story did you find the most interesting? Make sure to let us know in the comment section below. We‚Äôd love it if you gave this video a big thumbs up and hit that subscribe button. Thanks for watching!

title: 10 Improvised Stranger Things Scenes You Thought Were Real
description:
Stranger Things Scenes Where The Actors Weren't Acting.
Subscribe: http://bit.ly/Subscribe-to-Things

Stranger Things is, without a doubt, one of the biggest breakout TV hits of all time. The combination of the incredible direction, amazing cast, and compelling storylines make for a perfect TV show. Oh yeah, and the writing is awesome too. But even though it might not seem like it, there is actually a ton of improvisation that happens on the Stranger Things set, and much of what you see in the final episodes was not in the original script! There are so many moments, like the infamous first kiss between Max and Lucas in season two, which Sadie Sink swears was not in the original script, but was added by the Duffer Brothers when they realized how awkward she felt about it! Or the sweet moment between Millie Bobby Brown and Finn Wolfhard in the grocery store, where Mike is trying to find the right words to tell Eleven he still loves her. Dacre Montgomery who plays Billy went all out getting into character, so much so that he almost broke his skull in a terrifying unscripted moment, and Natalia Dyer and Charlie Heaton could barely keep it together during a hilarious breakfast scene that was improvised by Brett Gelman. David Harbour has added his own spice to Hooper‚Äôs character on more than one occasion, and even the famous Eggos scene was changed on the spot by Millie Bobby Brown! There are so many amazing improvised moments in all of Stranger Things, so check out the video to see them all.

title: 20 Millie Bobby Brown Blooper Scenes
description:
When you start working as young as she did, the blooper count is through the roof. Millie Bobby Brown: a jokester on set, a wicked talent, and an all-around goofy human. We‚Äôre taking a look back over her best bloopers throughout the years in everything from Stranger Things to Enola Holmes to the Godzilla franchise to some of Millie‚Äôs earliest on-screen appearances! 
When the roller skates broke out on the set of Stranger Things, it meant there were going to be a whole lot of bloopers while the actress got the hang of using them! When she was filming Enola Holmes, her costume didn‚Äôt restrict her in the least when it came to starting slapping fights with her co-stars! If there was a flub on set, Millie usually knew how to make the best of it, offering some pretty sassy improv! There were times when Millie said stuff her co-stars did NOT wanna hear. There were plenty of stumbles on the Stranger Things set with so many stunts, but one of Millie‚Äôs most embarrassing moments was when she fell simply walking down a hill. 
Then there were the days that Millie just TOTALLY blanked on set, unable to come up with a line to save her life. Maybe she was too busy thinking about all the flossing she wanted to do on set - and no, not the kind you‚Äôre thinking of. We‚Äôve even got a behind-the-scenes moment from one of the very first TV shows Millie did! She may not always be perfect on set, but she‚Äôs definitely a whole lot of fun!

title: What Spider-Man Looks Like Without CGI
description:
What Your Favorite Spider-Man Movie Scenes Look Like Without VFX! 
Subscribe: http://bit.ly/Subscribe-to-Things

While there are some who criticize the use of CGI, the fact is that many modern movies just wouldn‚Äôt be possible if they were limited to strictly practical effects. There‚Äôs a great deal of work, creativity, and passion that goes into VFX production, and some of our favorite films would look completely flat and barren without them.

Spider-Man: Far From Home has some of the most memorable uses of CGI out of all the Marvel movies, like the agonizing Illusion Battle where Mysterio torments Spider-Man with images pulled straight out of his nightmares. The grand scale of the battles all across Europe and the massive Elementals wouldn‚Äôt have been possible without CGI! But what do the sets of such heavily CGI'd scenes look like? Take a deep dive with us to see the world of mocap suits and green screens behind all of that Marvel movie magic!

VFX have become so convincing these days that it‚Äôs easy to forget that actors have to pretend to see things that aren‚Äôt really there. It gives us a whole new level of respect for performers like Tom Holland, Jake Gyllenhaal, Zendaya, and Samuel L. Jackson who can all convince us that they are seeing the same things we are, all while standing in an empty room!

See what it takes to bring all of these images to life on screen, from the canals of Venice and the tulip fields of the Netherlands to tech holograms and Spidey‚Äôs suit.

title: Actors Who Actually Shaved Their Hair For A Role
description:
Actors Who Struggled With Shaving Their Head For A Role
Subscribe: http://bit.ly/Subscribe-to-Things

Most actors know that, at some point, they‚Äôre going to have to cut and color their hair for a part in a movie or tv show. But sometimes, a role requires an even bigger change: a fully shaved head. While these days it‚Äôs easy enough for the amazing makeup and CGI teams to work around an actors real hair, there are the rare actors who are not only willing to cut their hair for real, but actually want to do it! Whether it‚Äôs to lend authenticity to a role, to fully get into the character, or just because it would make things a whole lot easier, these fearless actors threw caution to the wind and pulled out the clippers. Kristen Stewart had always wanted to shave off her famous brown locks, and when her deep sea thriller Underwater came along, it was the perfect opportunity. Millie Bobby Brown was only twelve years old when she shaved her head for Eleven in Stranger Things, and never looked back. Karen Gillan was terrified to cut her gorgeous red hair to play Nebula in Marvel‚Äôs Guardians Of The Galaxy, but when Marvel comes calling, you don‚Äôt say no. The Kissing Booth‚Äôs Joey King went bald for her role in The Act, Cara Delevigne did the same to play opposite Jaden Smith in Life In A Year, and Amandla Stenberg felt totally liberated by their own head-shaving journey. Anne Hathaway, Natalie Portman, and Olivia Cooke all did it on screen, but no one beats Charlize Theron and her iconic look as Furiosa in Mad Max: Fury Road!

title: Let Me In - We Are Here
description:
Sign the pledge to stand as one with people forced to flee conflict and disaster: http://weareheremovement.com/letmein/ or text "Let Me In" to 80077. 

What would you do? Where would you go? Watch LET ME IN starring Alicia Keys.

There are more refugees in the world today than at any point in history. And half of them are children. LET ME IN is a cinematic experience which reimagines the refugee crisis as if it was happening on America‚Äôs shores. Written and directed by Jonathan Olinger, this tale of survival and the remarkable power of the human spirit is inspired by the stories of real refugees. Starring Alicia Keys, the film follows her and her family's quest to survive after they experience unimaginable violence and embark on a journey that will forever change them. Along with thousands of Americans fleeing the conflict in Los Angeles, they must seek safety by attempting to cross the border into Mexico. Guided by their resolute love for each other and utter determination, the refugee family must navigate oceans and desserts in their unrelenting pursuit to find refuge and reunite. 

We Are Here and HUMAN present LET ME IN, a Jonathan Olinger film, produced by Mike Peay alongside Chelsea Franklin and Hannah Roodman. The film introduces Naliyah Vega alongside Ricardo Martin. The film‚Äôs executive producers are Leigh Blake, Alicia Keys and Erika Rose Santoro. The film‚Äôs soundtrack is a new song, ‚ÄúHallelujah,‚Äù off Alicia Keys' upcoming album to be released later this summer.

About We Are Here Movement
We Are Here Movement was founded in 2014 to empower people around a host of issues Alicia Keys cares about. They take the guesswork out of where and how to give through a curated coalition of organizations, causes and campaigns to provide the public with one-stop shopping to change the world.
http://weareheremovement.com

About HUMAN:
HUMAN is a global media platform that works with artists, causes and companies to create stories and experiences that connect humanity. 
http://thehumanstory.com

Named iTunes‚Äô ‚ÄúBreakthrough Pop Artist of 2011,‚Äù Perri earned critical applause and an increasingly fervent fan following with her extraordinary debut, lovestrong. Highlighted by the 5x-platinum-certified smash, ‚ÄúJar of Hearts,‚Äù the album ‚Äì produced by GRAMMY¬Æ-winning producer Joe Chiccarelli (The White Stripes, My Morning Jacket) ‚Äì entered the SoundScan/Billboard 200 among the top 5 upon its initial 2011 release, while also proving an unqualified international sensation with top 5 success in Australia and Ireland as well as top 10 sales in Canada and the United Kingdom. What‚Äôs more, the official ‚ÄúJar of Hearts‚Äù companion visual has drawn over 340 million views via Perri‚Äôs official YouTube channel.
 
Perri followed lovestrong. with the worldwide hit single, ‚ÄúA Thousand Years,‚Äù exclusively featured on Summit Entertainment/Chop Shop/Atlantic‚Äôs THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN ‚Äì PART 1 & 2‚Äì ORIGINAL MOTION PICTURE SOUNDTRACKS.  The track was a multi-format radio favorite, with top 10 airplay at Hot AC and top 25 spins at CHR/Top 40 outlets nationwide. ‚ÄúA Thousand Years‚Äù was of course accompanied by an equally popular companion video, now boasting over 1.1 billion individual views via YouTube alone.
 
HEAD OR HEART, Perri‚Äôs acclaimed second album, arrived in 2014, highlighted by the RIAA 2X platinum-certified single, ‚ÄúHuman.‚Äù Hailed by Billboard as a ‚Äúdelicate alt-pop ballad that should delight supporters of (Perri‚Äôs) breakthrough single ‚ÄòJar of Hearts,‚Äô‚Äù the track proved another colossal hit for Perri, lighting up the Top 10 at multi-format radio outlets nationwide, while also ascending to Top 10 status on the iTunes Store. In addition, the ‚ÄúHuman‚Äù companion video proved a true online phenomenon, now with close to 186 million views on Perri‚Äôs official YouTube channel.   

Christina recently released a brand new album, songs for carmella: lullabies & sing-a-longs, on January 17th via Elektra Records.  The release was timed with her daughter Carmella‚Äôs first birthday.  The album sees Perri performing a number of timeless standards alongside beloved Disney favorites and a brand new version of her 7x RIAA platinum-certified classic hit, ‚Äúa thousand years (lullaby),‚Äù in addition to a new original, titled ‚Äúyou mean the whole wide world to me.‚Äù
 
Christina also earned applause as an extraordinary live performer via a series of worldwide headline tours, with sold-out shows in North America, Europe, Asia and Latin America. Other highlights include high-profile TV appearances, festival performances, and treks with Ed Sheeran, OneRepublic, and Demi Lovato, as well as ‚ÄúThe Girls Night Out, Boys Can Come Too‚Äù co-headline tour alongside Colbie Caillat.

#ChristinaPerri #Lovestrong #TheLonely

Named iTunes‚Äô ‚ÄúBreakthrough Pop Artist of 2011,‚Äù Perri earned critical applause and an increasingly fervent fan following with her extraordinary debut, lovestrong. Highlighted by the 5x-platinum-certified smash, ‚ÄúJar of Hearts,‚Äù the album ‚Äì produced by GRAMMY¬Æ-winning producer Joe Chiccarelli (The White Stripes, My Morning Jacket) ‚Äì entered the SoundScan/Billboard 200 among the top 5 upon its initial 2011 release, while also proving an unqualified international sensation with top 5 success in Australia and Ireland as well as top 10 sales in Canada and the United Kingdom. What‚Äôs more, the official ‚ÄúJar of Hearts‚Äù companion visual has drawn over 340 million views via Perri‚Äôs official YouTube channel.
 
Perri followed lovestrong. with the worldwide hit single, ‚ÄúA Thousand Years,‚Äù exclusively featured on Summit Entertainment/Chop Shop/Atlantic‚Äôs THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN ‚Äì PART 1 & 2‚Äì ORIGINAL MOTION PICTURE SOUNDTRACKS.  The track was a multi-format radio favorite, with top 10 airplay at Hot AC and top 25 spins at CHR/Top 40 outlets nationwide. ‚ÄúA Thousand Years‚Äù was of course accompanied by an equally popular companion video, now boasting over 1.1 billion individual views via YouTube alone.
 
HEAD OR HEART, Perri‚Äôs acclaimed second album, arrived in 2014, highlighted by the RIAA 2X platinum-certified single, ‚ÄúHuman.‚Äù Hailed by Billboard as a ‚Äúdelicate alt-pop ballad that should delight supporters of (Perri‚Äôs) breakthrough single ‚ÄòJar of Hearts,‚Äô‚Äù the track proved another colossal hit for Perri, lighting up the Top 10 at multi-format radio outlets nationwide, while also ascending to Top 10 status on the iTunes Store. In addition, the ‚ÄúHuman‚Äù companion video proved a true online phenomenon, now with close to 186 million views on Perri‚Äôs official YouTube channel.   

Christina recently released a brand new album, songs for carmella: lullabies & sing-a-longs, on January 17th via Elektra Records.  The release was timed with her daughter Carmella‚Äôs first birthday.  The album sees Perri performing a number of timeless standards alongside beloved Disney favorites and a brand new version of her 7x RIAA platinum-certified classic hit, ‚Äúa thousand years (lullaby),‚Äù in addition to a new original, titled ‚Äúyou mean the whole wide world to me.‚Äù
 
Christina also earned applause as an extraordinary live performer via a series of worldwide headline tours, with sold-out shows in North America, Europe, Asia and Latin America. Other highlights include high-profile TV appearances, festival performances, and treks with Ed Sheeran, OneRepublic, and Demi Lovato, as well as ‚ÄúThe Girls Night Out, Boys Can Come Too‚Äù co-headline tour alongside Colbie Caillat.

#ChristinaPerri #Lovestrong #Distance

title: Christina Perri ft. Jason Mraz - Distance [Acoustic]
description:
Download on iTunes: http://smarturl.it/distance

'distance' is a song about loving someone at the wrong time in your life. maybe its too soon, maybe its too late, but never the less its about being around that one whom your heart longs for without being about to show your true feelings, without being able to tell them. its very hard to keep love a secret, and i wrote this song about the one time, i had to.

title: christina perri - jar of hearts (10th anniversary acoustic performance)
description:
happy 10 year anniversary to my baby jar of hearts!!! what a wild ride it has been. in honor of this special day, here is an acoustic version of the song that i recorded at home. i'm so grateful for all the love and support i have received from day one ! most special thanks to my team of fairy godmothers on this fateful day: keltie knight, stacey tookey, tom gates, ryan chisholm, philly brenthall, steven schillaci, jordan davidoff, kathryn mccormick, and billy bell. without all of you i wouldn't be here. i was catapulted into the stars on that day and i have never come down since! thank you for this life! i wonder what the next decade will bring üíï -ceeps

filmed by: mario costabile 
engineered by: paul costabile 
produced & mixed by: whakiao taahi 
mastered by: emily lazar

Lyrics:
I know I can't take one more step towards you
‚ÄòCause all that's waiting is regret
Don't you know I'm not your ghost anymore
You lost the love I loved the most

I've learned to live, half alive
And now you want me one more time

Who do you think you are?
Runnin' 'round leaving scars
Collecting your jar of hearts
And tearing love apart
You're gonna catch a cold
From the ice inside your soul
So don't come back for me
Who do you think you are?

I hear you're asking all around
If I am anywhere to be found
But I have grown too strong
To ever fall back in your arms

I've learned to live, half alive
And now you want me one more time

Who do you think you are?
Runnin' 'round leaving scars
Collecting your jar of hearts
And tearing love apart
You're gonna catch a cold
From the ice inside your soul
So don't come back for me
Who do you think you are?

Dear, it took so long just to feel alright
Remember how to put back the light in my eyes
I wish I had missed the first time that we kissed
‚ÄòCause you broke all your promises
And now you're back
You don't get to get me back

Who do you think you are?
Runnin' 'round leaving scars
Collecting your jar of hearts
And tearing love apart
You're gonna catch a cold
From the ice inside your soul
Don't come back for me
Don't come back at all

Who do you think you are?
Runnin' 'round leaving scars
Collecting your jar of hearts
And tearing love apart

From the ice inside your soul

title: christina perri - tiny victories
description:
‚Äútiny victories‚Äù from the film FOSTER available now https://christinaperri.lnk.to/tinyvictories
tiny victories music video is here! it features all the beautiful and amazing people that share their stories in the documentary FOSTER on HBO. it‚Äôs such an important, powerful & truthful story about the foster care system. im so honored to be a part of it!

tiny victories
(christina perri, ag)

some days i look in the mirror and i think 
the meanest things
all the meanest things
some days i‚Äôm holding my self worth up
by a string
a string
but everyday that i don‚Äôt hide myself away
to me,
is a tiny victory

some days it feels like a wrecking ball is swinging
through my ribcage, my ribcage
some nights i‚Äôm just a million broken pieces singing
on a stage
i‚Äôm a little more broken open but a little more free
and that‚Äôs a tiny victory

and if battles can win a war
i can keep picking my sword up off the floor
and learn to treasure these
tiny victories
tiny victories 

some days giving up on myself looks so 
easy to do, it‚Äôs easy to do
the struggle is slow, i‚Äôm barely moving the needle
and the cracks may be few, but there‚Äôs light coming through

and if battles can win a war
i can keep picking my sword up off the floor
and learn to treasure these

tiny victories
tiny victories
tiny victories
tiny victories

and everyday that i don‚Äôt hide myself away
everyday that i don‚Äôt hide myself away
to me,
is a tiny victory

Adam picks up a NERF Rival Nemesis blaster, and upgrades it with a custom magazine to hold a THOUSAND soft plastic NERF balls. title: How to Mold and Cast a Lightsaber!
description:
Frank Ippolito joins us at Adam's shop for another step-by-step tutorial in prop making. This time, we learn how to make a two-part silicone mold that we can use to cast resin copies of complex objects. We demonstrate the technique by duplicating a lightsaber prop made by Adam!

Video shot and edited by Joey Fameli

Music Library provided by Jingle Punks

Thanks to Smooth-On for providing materials for this video

#FrankIppolito #StarWars #Lightsaber

title: Astronaut Chris Hadfield and Chef Traci Des Jardins Make a Space Burrito
description:
Keeping in mind the challenge of mixing food ingredients in micro-gravity, chef Traci Des Jardins concocts a recipe for spicing up astronaut Chris Hadfield's meals on board the International Space Station. Commander Hadfield also shares with Jamie and Adam the foods he misses most after spending six months in space.

description:
The beloved Wall-E robot was just computer generated graphics in the Pixar movie, but fans have spent years trying to bring him to life. We visit Mike McMaster's workshop to see his incredible life-size Wall-E, a remote controlled robot that lives among an R2-D2 droid and other pets on Mike's orange farm.

title: Tasting Astronaut Food: Inside NASA's Space Food Systems Laboratory
description:
How does the dining experience in space compare to that on Earth? We visited NASA's Space Food Systems Laboratory at the Johnson Space Center in Houston to learn about the history of space food and sample some of the same food that the astronauts on the International Space Station eat every day.

Photos of all the food we tasted at NASA here (space smoothies!): http://www.tested.com/science/space/455535-tubes-tortillas-history-space-food-photos/


#NASA #SpaceFood

title: How the BB-8 Sphero Toy Works
description:
In 2015 we visited the workshop of Mike Senna, a droid builder who has made his own R2-D2 and Wall-E robots. Mike's next project is recreating the BB-8 droid featured in Star Wars Episode VII: The Force Awakens! We discuss what's known so far about how BB-8 was built for the film, how a remote-controlled model could be built, and take apart a BB-8 Sphero to see if we can learn anything from the small-scale toy!

Follow Mike Senna's droid and robot projects at: http://sennasr2d2.blogspot.com/

title: Adam Savage's One Day Builds: Han Solo's DL-44 Blaster
description:
Adam has constructed a Blade Runner pistol and Indiana Jones' revolver, but not Han Solo's blaster from Star Wars A New Hope. Fortunately, the makers at the Replica Prop Forum have thoroughly researched the details of this prop and have faithfully recreated the components needed to build it. Adam and Norm run through the blaster's signature details and then work together to assemble this iconic space gun.

The RPF Han Solo Blaster research thread: http://www.therpf.com/f9/anh-hero-dl-44-discussion-three-anh-greeblies-found-118186/

title: Astronaut Chris Hadfield and Chef David Chang Test Gourmet Space Food
description:
Jamie and Adam chat with astronaut Chris Hadfield about the limitations of food preparation on board the International Space Station. While astronauts can't really cook their own meals, Jamie and Adam challenge celebrated chef David Chang with the task of devising a recipe that Commander Hadfield can test...in space!

title: Adam Savage's Aluminum Foil Ball Cut In Half! (Ft. Waterjet Channel)
description:
In March 2022, Adam created a shiny solid sphere of aluminum using just a roll of standard foil wrap -- the so-called tin foil ball challenge (https://youtu.be/q_YZX1SgZ5Y). title: Adam Savage's Overlook Hotel Maze Model
description:
Over the span of a month, Adam designed and built an accurate replica of the hedge maze architectural model from Stanley Kubrick's The Shining. The maze model, as seen in The Overlook Hotel, is only seen briefly, but reference screenshots from throughout the film allowed Adam to painstakingly recreate it. The project ended up as one of Adam's more labor-intensive builds in recent memory!

Watch our in-depth discussion of this maze build here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NRAqx8stEnY

title: Adam Savage's First Gundam Build‚ÄîRX-78-2 Perfect Grade Unleashed!
description:
On Saturday, Nov. 19, 2022, at 12 pm ET, Adam Savage will be in New York at the Javits Center for Anime NYC. He'll be there for this year‚Äôs GUNDAM EXPO USA, and will be taking part in an attempt to make a Guinness World Record for most people building a Gunpla kit simultaneously. 

Watch the build LIVE: https://youtu.be/5vWzCFuatoQ
GUNDAM EXPO USA: https://en.gundam.info/content/expo-usa2022/
AnimeNYC: https://animenyc.com/

Adam builds his first ever Gundam model (aka Gunpla)! In partnership with Bandai Namco Collectibles, Bandai Spirits, and the Gundam Online Expo 2021, Adam and the Tested team put together the incredible PERFECT GRADE UNLEASHED RX-78-2 GUNDAM model kit, admiring its beautiful interior mechanical frame design and iconic exterior Gundam armor. Adam is stunned by the detail of the model's parts and the precision of the pieces that satisfyingly snap-fit together! 

Gundam model(aka Gunpla) and many other products could be purchased at Premium Bandai US and Bandai Namco Collectibles (dba Bluefin Distribution): https://p-bandai.com/us

title: Weta Workshop Sculptor's Tabletop Miniature World!
description:
Adam Savage checks in on the status of sculptor Johnny Fraser-Allen's tabletop model, which has grown from the intricate Labyrinth we saw two years ago to a sprawling world steeped in fantasy architecture and landscapes that come alive. We're awestruck by the design and details of these models, which Johnny has brilliantly made to be modular and customizable. We can't wait to play in Hagglethorn Hollow!

Shot by Steve Unwin 

A note from Johnny about the status of this model and kit: 

Since the filming of this video the product has gone through significant development and after consideration to the market for this product, we have decided to release the range first as physical products with 3D STL files in the near future. Hagglethorn Hollow is coming to Kickstarter on September 26th 2018

title: Tested: DJI Phantom 2 Vision+ Quadcopter Drone

title: Adam Savage Incognito as Chewbacca with C-3PO!
description:
For 2017's Silicon Valley Comic Con, Adam goes incognito in one of his favorite cosplays--Chewbacca! This upgraded Chewie is a bit different than the Wookiee costume he wore a few years back, with a new bandolier, bowcaster, and mask. title: Making a Life-Size Dragon! (Monster Hunter 4 Ultimate)
description: How do you sculpt a realistic dragon, let alone one that has to be life size? That's what effects artist Frank Ippolito did for Capcom's booth at this year's E3 gaming conference. We visit Frank's shop before the event to see the in-progress dragon--the Gore Magala from the game Monster Hunter 4 Ultimate--before it's brought to life and then behold the impressive finished piece on the E3 show floor.

title: Adam Savage's One Day Builds: Rhombic Dodecahedron with Matt Parker!
description:
Buy Matt Parker's Humble Pi: https://amzn.to/367UmBV

In this special One Day Build filmed earlier this year, mathematician Matt Parker visits the cave to build a rhombic dodecahedron with Adam! Be prepared for lots of fun geometry discussion as Adam and Matt try to make abstract math concepts tangible with a physical build. They also take this construction a few steps further by lining the inside of the polyhedron with mirrors and LED strips for an infinty mirrored effect!

Shot and edited by Gunther Kirsch
NOTE: This video was recorded before the Bay Area's shelter-in-place policy.

title: Adam Savage's One Day Builds: Micrometer Gauge Box Set!
description:
Evapo-Rust Rust Remover: https://amzn.to/3dPXg5N

To aid in his machining projects, Adam recently picked up a full set of micrometer screw gauges--precision calibrated tools for measuring his machined parts and components. Today's One Day Build is a deep dive into how measurement affects machining processes and the ways to achieve ultra-precise measurement, and the customization of a beautiful wooden case to organize and hold all of these important gauges.

title: How To Make a Gory Hand Prop for Halloween!
description:
We visit Frank Ippolito's shop to learn about making ultra-realistic fake hands as Halloween props. Frank walks us through the step-by-step process of molding your own hand and making a silicone casting, and then cutting and painting up the fake hand to look realistically gory. It's actually a special effect you can do by yourself without any assistance!

Video shot and edited by Joey Fameli

Music Library provided by Jingle Punks

Thanks to Smooth-On for providing materials for this video 



#FrankIppolito #Prop

title: Tour the Boeing 737 Flight Simulator Built in a Garage
description:
Support videos like this -- and get a free gift -- by becoming a Tested Premium Member: http://tested.com/membership

Air traffic controller James Price has spent the past decade building a full-sized Boeing 737 flight simulator in his garage. Will and Norm board the cockpit of this amazing project to learn how it works.

title: Adam Savage's One Day Builds: Cosmonaut Model Kit
description:
In this episode of One Day Builds, Adam spends a day at the shop assembling and painting a beautiful 1/6th scale garage kit, based on the fantastical characters of artist Derek Stenning. Adam and Norm each work on their own kit, and Adam teaches us some painting and weathering techniques to bring out the intricate details on this sci-fi cosmonaut figure.

Photos of the completed kits here: http://www.tested.com/art/makers/494687-photo-gallery-assembling-and-painting-16th-scale-figure-kit/

description:
Adam delights in the testing of his new extended finger gloves, a 3D-printed mechanical design by Gary Fay Creations. This articulated design gives Adam a wide range of hyperrealistic movement in his elongated fingers, which is both creepy and mesmerizing! The fit is fantastic, and Adam can't wait to incorporate them into a future cosplay!

title: How Astronauts Put on Space Suits
description:
Photos of our time with the space suit here: http://www.tested.com/science/space/456648-photo-gallery-putting-nasas-space-suit/

We've all seen NASA's white space suit that astronauts have been wearing since the Apollo missions. But what does an astronaut wear underneath that iconic suit's shell? We visit NASA to learn about all the essentials of extravehicular space wear, all the way down to the emergency diapers.


#NASA #SpaceSuit

title: How to Build a FPV Racing Quadcopter!
description:
After learning about the world of FPV quadcopter racing, we couldn't wait to build our own. With the help of Lumenier and FPV quadcopter flyer Charpu, we learn about all the components needed to build a solid mini racing quadcopter for under $850, FPV kit included. Charpu helps us assemble the quadcopter and gives useful tips for first-time builders. It's really not that difficult!

Thanks to Lumenier for providing parts for this build: www.getfpv.com

Video shot and edited by Norman Chan
Music by Jinglepunks

Components:
QAV250 Mini FPV Quadcopter frame: http://www.getfpv.com/multi-rotor-frames/qav250-mini-fpv-quad/qav250-mini-fpv-quadcopter-carbon-fiber-edition.html

Lumenier FXC1806 2300kv motors: http://www.getfpv.com/fxc1806-14-2300kv.html

Lumenier 12A Electronic Speed Controllers: 
http://www.getfpv.com/lumenier-12-amp-esc-with-simonk-firmware.html

Gemfan 5x3 Propellers: http://www.getfpv.com/gemfan-5x3-propeller-2-blade-set-of-4-black.html

Lumenier 1300mAh Lipo Battery: http://www.getfpv.com/lumenier-1300mah-3s-35c-lipo-battery-xt60.html

Acro Naze32 Flight Controller: http://www.getfpv.com/acro-naze-32-flight-controller-right-angle.html

Fat Shark Teleporter V3 Video Goggles: http://www.getfpv.com/fatshark-teleporter-v3-video-goggles.html

FrSky Taranis X9D 2.4GHz Radio & Receiver: http://www.getfpv.com/frsky-taranis-x9d-plus-2-4ghz-accst-radio-x8r-combo-mode-2.html

Video guides to setting up the flight controller: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ozwkaenbGUM
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rj6IXA2hDW0

Hovership 3D-printed quadcopter frames: http://www.hovership.com/

Great forum resources for FPV quad builds: www.rcgroups.com and www.fpvlab.com

Find Charpu's FPV videos here: https://www.youtube.com/user/CharpuFPV

title: Inside Adam Savage's Cave: The Bourne Identity Burn Bag
description:
When Jason Bourne tracked down his safe deposit box in The Bourne Identity, he found everything he needed to survive within it. Adam shows Norm his version of the Bourne burn bag, which includes a mixture of actual props from the film, recreations, and replicas.

Watch more videos from Adam's workshop at http://www.tested.com


#AdamSavage #BourneIdentity #BurnBag

title: Hands-On with DJI's Inspire 1 Quadcopter!
description:
DJI's new quadcopter is one of the coolest we've seen--a huge upgrade from the current Phantom 2 Vision+ we've been using. The Inspire 1 can record 4K video, lifts its propeller struts, and transmit clear HD video to the pilot. We chat in-depth with Eric Cheng, DJI's Director of Aerial Imaging, about all the new features in the Inspire 1 and then take it out for a test flight!

Thanks to Eric Cheng and DJI for the video coverage and showing us the Inspire !


#DJI #Inspire1

description:
Adam Savage has been operating Boston Dynamics' Spot robot for a few months, getting to know the ins and outs of its capabilities. While more projects with Spot are in the works, Adam today answers questions about how Spot works, showing core features like how it's manually controlled to how it can autonomously navigate planned missions. Its different gaits are mesmerizing!

Note: This is not a sponsored video. Boston Dynamics has leased Spot to Adam Savage as part of their early adopter program. While Tested is chronicling some of Adam's experience with the robot, there is no obligation for Tested (or Adam) to publish videos, photos or media of any kind.

title: Meet Maslow, the $350 CNC Cutting Machine
description:
We welcome Bar Smith and Hannah Teagle to show us their Maslow CNC cutting machine, which comes in a $350 kit. This CNC uses an upright design to hold a 4x8 foot sheet of plywood, and is completely open source. We talk about the goals of the Maslow CNC project and what kind of big things it can make!

title: Adam Savage Explores a Military Surplus Store
description:
Will and Norm meet up with Adam during one of the Behind the Myths tour stops, and the three visit a local military surplus store in Bakersfield, CA. Adam browses for finds that are best bought in person, and we all marvel at the store's collection of vintage vehicles.

(In case you're wondering, our camera could only support two wireless mics, so Norm wasn't plugged in during this shoot! And yes, we got inside the tank! Adam wrote about it here: http://www.tested.com/art/makers/459218-tour-bus-diaries-im-tank/)

title: Adam Savage Improves a Cat Exercise Wheel
description:
Adam's friend Traci Des Jardins visits the Cave with a challenge: fix and improve her cat's exercise wheel. With some tweaks and swapping out of parts, the giant wheel's operation is greatly improved. It ended up a fun little project that required a bit of problem solving, and Traci's cat got a great workout out of it at the end!

Watch Adam's conversation with Traci about cooking and making recipes here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J6bAZ8RhBY4

title: Hands-On with DJI's Phantom 3 Professional Quadcopter Drone!
description:
We take the new DJI Phantom 3 Advanced and Professional quadcopters out for some test flights! Eric Cheng of DJI joins us to discuss how these new quads differ from previous models in terms of  their flight capability and cameras, bringing in features previously introduced in the Inspire 1. We then put these quadcopters up in the air to test the new stabilization systems and 4K video! 

Thanks to Eric Cheng for some of the Phantom 3 video footage.

title: Tested Builds a Hydrogen Converter
description:

Special thanks to John Duncan for supervising the shop during our build!
